2004 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
2004 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Nominee
9989.description: The Arctic natives go from ice floe to ice floe to catch fresh fish for their soup. Every Inuit family has their own special recipe and each one is of course, the best. The players can only read their recipe cards telling them exactly which fish belong in the pot at the beginning of the game. If a player forgets then only the oracle mountain can help him find out which ingredients he needs. Here, he will be able to see his recipe reflected in the ice. Contents: 14 ice floes, 1 with a mirror, 1 igloo, 1 iceberg, 4 Inuit pieces with a harpoon, 10 recipe cards, 1 dice, 1 bag with 64 fishes, instructions
9989.name: Mare Polare

9990.name: Heavy Weight Boxing
9990.description:
HEAVYWEIGHT BOXING is a two-player game with a playing time of about 30 minutes a bout. You are a manager controlling the ring strategy of your fighter, balancing his punching power and offensive and defensive boxing abilities against those of his opponent. You can play two contemporary (1979) or all-time-great fighters creating many "what-if?" situations.
This is not a long-winded, overly complex game but was in the vanguard of beer and pretzels games before the German games invasion. You should be able to read the rules and play your 1st bout within an hour. Advanced optional rules can be added later for more realistic flavor.
Components are meager but complete. Included is a simulated boxing ring with 2 corners divided into sections for each fighter's stance of Aggressive/Counter/Defense. Also included are 2 realistic metal fighters (look great if you paint them), 2 Game charts, and a pad of score sheets, rulebook, 1D6, 20 Contemporary and 20 All-time-great fighter cards.
A turn consists of simultaneously: 1) Secretly choosing your stance, 2) rolling on the "Boxing ability vs. stance" chart for any punches landed, 3) rolling for each landed punch on the "Punching power vs. defense" chart for results, 4) recording points and stats on the score sheet, 5) roll recovery if needed and repeat sequence 3x for each round.
Advanced optional rules include Endurance, TKO, Injuries, Solitaire, Rope-a-dope, Haymakers, Clinching, Stuns, Head Butts, Tiring and everyone's favorite; "add your own" rule.
This game has a real nice boxing feel to it and is remarkably easy to play, especially if you're not the bookkeeper statistician. If you are creative you can come up with modern fighter cards based on their stats.

boardgamehonor: 1975 Charles S. Roberts Best Professional Game Nominee
9991.description: Von Manstein is an operational level simulation of land warfare in South Russia during the 1941-1944 period. The map covers the Ukraine from Stalingrad west, and parts of Poland and Rumania. Uses a single Combat Results table to determine outcomes of battle. Provides Air War points to be allocated. Units are essentially Division and up. Game contains 8 different scenarios (from 6 to 12 turns). Rules are about 5 pages (with specific additional items in the scenario) and 200 counters
9991.name: Von Manstein: Battles for the Ukraine 1941-1944

9993.name: Don't Go Overboard
9993.description: Be the first player to place all of his magnetized sailors on board the ship. Sailors being placed on the ship can either attract or repel each other. If your sailor attracts then he is on board, if he repels then it's man overboard.

9994.name: Donut Disaster
9994.description: Be the first player to get rid of all your donuts by placing them on the soft rod on top of the temperamental donut-making machine before the machine explodes and sends everybody's donuts flying. If it goes off on your turn, try to catch as many donuts as you can so you don't get stuck with them.

9995.name: Triple Play
9995.description: The object of the game is for a player to score ten "triple plays" by filling 10 triangles on the center wheel with marbles. Players try to accomplish this task while the center wheel rotates.

9996.name: Perspective The Time Line Game
9996.description: It's the game about time, the game that lets you construct your own time lines of history. Which came first? The American Revolution or the Industrial Revolution? Cleopatra or Socrates? Joan of Arc or Marco Polo? Place the cards in order on the colorful Time Line Board. Play all your cards and win. Every game is different. It all depends on the cards you're dealt. And the more you play, the more you learn. Contains 100 basic set cards,100 master set cards, board, custom die and rule sheet.

9997.name: Australian Grand Prix
9997.description: In Formula One Grand Prix Racing, the drivers' outcome is determined by his/her abilities of skill and judgment combined with elements of luck and fate. These same factors have been integrated into the Australian Formula One Grand Prix board game. Characteristics of actual Formula One race cars, tracks, teams, and sponsors have been included so that the game may be interesting as well as informative. You will surely experience the thrills and some disappointments that make Grand Prix racing so exciting!

9998.name: Congo The Movie
boardgamefamily: Country: Democratic Republic of the Congo
9998.description: Your mission is a deadly one, find the Laser Diamond in the City of Zinj. If fear doesn't stop you - hippos, earthquakes and gray gorillas just might, Can the expedition survive long enough to reach the city, then find the hidden diamond? Set your life energy dial. Then roll the dice to follow the jungle path. Escape danger by spinning special spinners and rolling dice. But watch out. Life energy levels can get critically low. Players may have to protect each other to survive. In the City of Zinj, search for the diamond. Leave no stones unturned. The player who finds it wins the game.

9999.description: Hades has taken over Mt. Olympus, and it's up to you to save the day. Make your way to the top of the mountain with the help of your trusted winged stallion, Pegasus. But be careful - a battle with a terrifying Titan or evil monster could send you down the mountain. Be the first to reach the summit and restore Zeus to power, and you win.
9999.name: Hercules Save Mt. Olympus 3-D Game

10000.name: Roll and Score Poker Game
10000.description: Each of you will be rolling 15 poker dice in an attempt to form certain card-hand combinations in the first roll when scoring is highest. If you are unsuccessful, take three more successive rolls, but score fewer points on each roll. However, you can save any of the dice and roll fewer, if you decide it is to your advantage. Jokers count against you and are removed from play whenever they appear. If you are unsuccessful after 4 rolls, score 0. If you are successful, receive the number of points given on the score sheet for each successive roll.
